detaileddescription.para:
Creates a blank file at the specified location, overwriting any other file at the given location
filename
The file which the system will attempt to open

Opens the provided file and appends the provided string to the file, before closing it. If the file does not exist, it creates it.
filename
The target file location
content
The desired string to be appended to the file (accepts control characters)

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &filename, const std::vector< T > &contentVector, const std::string &delimiter, bool includeTerminalLineBreak)
memberdef.name: writeVectorToFile

detaileddescription.para:
As with writeStringToFile, but accepts a vector of templated entities. The writing loops over the vector and writes them one at a time, separated by the delimiter object
filename
The target file location
contentVector
A vector of templated objects to be written to file
delimiter
The character(s) to be written after every entry of contentVector except the final entry
includeTerminalLineBreak
If true, appends a linebreak character at the end of the vector. Useful for sequentially writing rows of data to file.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &filename, const std::vector< std::vector< T >> contentMatrix, const std::string &columnDelimiter, const std::string &rowDelimiter)
memberdef.name: writeMatrixToFile

detaileddescription.para:
As with writeStringToFile and writeVectorToFile, but accepts a vector<vector> of templated entities. The writing loops over the outer vector (the rows), and then at each step, the inner vectors(the columns). Writing them one at a time, separated by the delimiter objects. Objects need not be square matrices to be successfully written.
filename
The target file location
contentMatrix
A vector<vector> of templated objects to be written to file
columnDelimiter
The character(s) to be written after every individual entry except the final entry in each row
rowRelimiter
The character(s) to be written at the end of each row including the final row. This will probably be a linebreak!

Checks for the existence of the provided file location works on both files and directories.
filename
the name of the file or directory to be checked
true if location exists (and is accessible), false if not

Checks the status of the target directory, if it does not exist, attempts to create it. Works wherever the mkdir command is installed.
directory
Path (relative or absolute) to the desired directory
A mkdirReturn object detailing the success + associated messages for the request

Calls a system-rm on the provided location, and attempts to remove it.
location
The target location on which rm is called
recursive
If true, appends -r to the command, and so removes all subdirectories etc.

briefdescription.para: Performs obvious matrix addition (a+b)_ij = a_ij + b_ij. Throws an error if the matrices are not the same size.

parameterdescription.para: The first vector to be summed
The second vector to be summed (order is irrelevant)

briefdescription.para: Performs obvious matrix subtraction (a-b)_ij = a_ij - b_ij. Throws an error if the matrices are not the same size.

parameterdescription.para: The first vector
The vector to be subtracted from the first

briefdescription.para: Adds the value of scalar to every element in the matrix.

parameterdescription.para: The matrix to be summed
The scalar to be added element-wise

briefdescription.para: Exactly equivalent to JSL::operator+(const Matrix &lhs, const double &scalar), just swapped around.

parameterdescription.para: The scalar to be added element-wise
The matrix to be summed

briefdescription.para: Subtracts the value of scalar to every element in the Matrix.

parameterdescription.para: The base matrix
The scalar to be subtracted from the base matrix element wise

briefdescription.para: Naive element-wise scalar multiplication.

parameterdescription.para: The value to multiply elements by
The matrix to multiply

simplesect.para: The pointwise product of the elements of rhs and the scalar

briefdescription.para: Alias of JSL::operator+(const double &scalar,const Matrix &rhs) with the operation order swapped around.

parameterdescription.para: The matrix to multiply
The value to multiply elements by

simplesect.para: The pointwise product of the elements of lhs and the scalar

briefdescription.para: Essentially an alias for JSL::operator+(const double &scalar,const Matrix &rhs) with the scalar set to one-over itself, i.e. pointwise division of the provided matrix.

parameterdescription.para: The matrix to divide
The value to divide elements by

simplesect.para: The pointwise divisor of the elements of lhs and the scalar

briefdescription.para: A slightly odd operation (included for completeness) - adds the value of scalar to the negative of the elements of the vector.

parameterdescription.para: The value which acts as a base
The vector which will be subtracted elementwise from the base scalar

briefdescription.para: Calls JSL::Matrix::to_string() and then passes it to the provided stream, enabling sweet, smooth output such as std::cout << M << std::endl.

parameterdescription.para: An output stream capable of parsing strings
A Matrix object to be inserted into the stream for output

simplesect.para: A reference to the modified stream

briefdescription.para: The standard dot product on R^n.

parameterdescription.para: Vector 1,
Vector 2 (order irrelevant)

briefdescription.para: The standard cross product only defined on R^3 (throws an error else)

parameterdescription.para: Vector 1
Vector 2 (order relevant - using standard conventions Vector 1 x Vector 2)

briefdescription.para: Uses Vector::Norm() and VectorDotProduct() to extract an angle between the vectors.

parameterdescription.para: Vector 1,
Vector 2 (order irrelevant)

simplesect.para: The angle between the two vectors (between 0 and M_PI)

briefdescription.para: Performs obvious vector addition (a+b)_i = a_i + b_i. Throws an error if the vectors are not the same size.

parameterdescription.para: The first vector to be summed
The second vector to be summed (order is irrelevant)

briefdescription.para: Performs obvious vector subtraction (a-b)_i = a_i - b_i. Throws an error if the vectors are not the same size.

parameterdescription.para: The base vector
The vector to be subtracted from the base vector (order does matter!)

briefdescription.para: Adds the value of scalar to every element in the vector.

parameterdescription.para: The vector to be summed
The scalar to be added element-wise

briefdescription.para: Exactly equivalent to JSL::operator+(const Vector &lhs, const double &scalar), just swapped around.

parameterdescription.para: The scalar to be added element-wise
The vector to be summed

briefdescription.para: Subtracts the value of scalar to every element in the vector.

parameterdescription.para: The base vector
The scalar to be subtracted from the base vector element wise

briefdescription.para: A slightly odd operation (included for completeness) - adds the value of scalar to the negative of the elements of the vector.

parameterdescription.para: The value which acts as a base
The vector which will be subtracted elementwise from the base scalar

briefdescription.para: Naive element-wise scalar multiplication.

parameterdescription.para: The value to multiply elements by
The vector to multiply

simplesect.para: The pointwise product of the elements of rhs and the scalar

briefdescription.para: Alias of JSL::operator+(const double &scalar,const Vector &rhs) with the operation order swapped around.

parameterdescription.para: The vector to multiply
The value to multiply elements by

simplesect.para: The pointwise product of the elements of lhs and the scalar

briefdescription.para: Essentially an alias for JSL::operator+(const double &scalar,const Vector &rhs) with the scalar set to one-over itself, i.e. pointwise division of the provided vector.

parameterdescription.para: The vector to divide
The value to divide elements by

simplesect.para: The pointwise divisor of the elements of lhs and the scalar

briefdescription.para: Executes the pointwise (Hadamard) product of two vectors.

parameterdescription.para: The first vector to be multiplied
The second vector to be multiplied (order is irrelevant)

briefdescription.para: Calls JSL::Vector::to_string() and then passes it to the provided stream, enabling sweet, smooth output such as std::cout << v1 << std::endl.

parameterdescription.para: An output stream capable of parsing strings
A vector object to be inserted into the stream for output

simplesect.para: A reference to the modified stream

detaileddescription.para:
Splits the string based on the chosen delimiter. Repeated delimiters are ignored.
s
The input string to be split (unchanged)
delimiter
The delimiting character
A vector of non-empty strings.

Get current system time in a readable format (note: was previously called PrintCurrentTime)
A string of the readable format

Given a duration in seconds, convert it into standard Day/Hour/Minute/Second formatted string. Times less than 1 second are reported as "less than 1 second"
timeInSeconds
The time to be converted
A human-readable string equal to the input

Calls FormatDuration() on the duration of the start and endpoints of a chrono stopwatch.
start
A chrono object representing the start of the duration
end
The corresponding end-point chrono
